intro: Paramollugo, commonly known as the African violet, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. These plants are characterized by their rosette-forming leaves and showy, often colorful flowers. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments and are popular as ornamental plants. Paramollugo species are herbaceous, with some varieties having hairy or waxy foliage. Their flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
